title.narrative: Remedial classes in Shahba - support to homework (Acronym: Remedial class -project)

description.narrative: Over thousend families from other parts of Syria live displaced in Shahba South Syria. Shahba Relief Committee (SRC) is a network of the city NGOs and active citizens. SRC started 2012 humanitarian and development activities Feel at home for both refugees and residents of Shahba. SRC noticed the problem of irregular attendance or school-drop-out of children. However it is a must to take care of children's education also in conflict-affected times (UNICEF Minimum Standards of Education in Emergencies 2000). Objectives posed by SRC are: ensure the prerequisites for developing the physical intellectual creative expression and communication skills of the childrenTherefore Remedial class -project implements activities to support the children's successful attend ance at school in Shahba. Project will be implemented together with families and in cooperation with Shahba city education department. Remedial class activities are new for SRC and through the experience will further ideas be elaborated to support the stud ying at school. The beneficiaries are two groups of children (40 grades 1-2) who who might have missed school or attend school irregularly and their parents. The children to the Remedial class -project will be referred by the school counsellor of Shahba an d by social workers of Shahba if the family cannot be reached through school. Project includes afternoon lessons two times/week the lessons beginning with physical exercise and then focusing in homework assistance of most important subjects. The teachers w ork part-time (2 times/week 3 hours/group management reports and cooperation with parents 1 h total 7 hours/week/group). For each group a parents'voluntary network will be organised 2 of parents or siblings assisting in each activity afernoons (weekly 12 t urns for the parents). The project will be evaluated as successful when the irregular attendance at school will turn regular and the parents participate and are satisfied with the activity afternoons. The equal opprotunies for boys and girls are ensured an d during the activity afternoons the enviromental sustainabilty and reproductive health are promoted.
